intro: Virea, commonly known as the common bluebell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Plantaginaceae. These plants are characterized by their bell-shaped flowers, which are typically blue or purple in color. Virea species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are often found in woodland or grassy areas. They are perennial herbs with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are often clustered in racemes and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
